summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It references the transfer of discovery materials pertinent to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) and the recipient of discovery materials as referenced in the letter.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The signatory of the letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Silvio J. Motto
persons.context: The building housing the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York is named after him.

locations: Silvio J. Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC), 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal communication from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It confirms the transfer of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.
The document is dated October 29, 2020, during the pre-trial phase of Maxwell's prosecution.
Audrey Strauss was the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time.
